articles.title: Man Utd teammates Lisandro Martinez and Raphael Varane share moment after World Cup final
articles.description: Manchester United defender Lisandro Martinez took time out from Argentina's wild World Cup celebrations to comfort Raphael Varane after France lost out on penalties at the Lusail Stadium
articles.content:
Lisandro Martinez was spotted taking the time to console his Manchester United teammate Raphael Varane after Argentina beat France in the World Cup final following a dramatic penalty shootout.

articles.title: Emiliano Martínez saves Argentina in clutch for World Cup title
articles.description: This looked like the moment for France, which had already fought back from 2-0 and 3-2 deficits to tie the game at three.
articles.content:
Emiliano Martínez was still in tears as he tried to answer questions, the moment overwhelming the Argentine goalkeeper more than anything could have during the game itself.

articles.title: Argentina's Lionel Messi erases any doubts with World Cup run
articles.description: Argentina's Lionel Messi did not cry, at least not at first.
articles.content:
Lionel Messi did not cry, at least not at first.

articles.title: North Texas soccer fans enjoy dramatic World Cup final between Argentina, France
articles.description: Even casual soccer fans got a treat with Sunday's FIFA World Cup final, as Lionel Messi's Argentina defeated Kylian Mbappe’s France on penalty kicks.
articles.content:
Even casual soccer fans got a treat with Sunday's FIFA World Cup final, as Lionel Messi's Argentina defeated Kylian Mbappe’s France on penalty kicks.
Across North Texas, fans got to enjoy what some are calling the best final ever.

articles.title: World Cup: Hundreds of thousands of fans pour onto streets of Buenos Aires after Argentina beat France
articles.description: Lionel Messi finally won the biggest prize in football - the only trophy to have eluded him - and it was he that fans back home hailed for their victory.
articles.content:
Argentina's triumph in the World Cup final has sent hundreds of thousands of ecstatic fans pouring out onto the streets of Buenos Aires.

articles.description: Di Maria, who returned from injury, was the star of Argentina's rollercoaster ride on Sunday

articles.title: World Cup final: Lionel Messi’s ‘eerie’ link to Argentinian football icon Diego Maradona
articles.description: The Argentina superstar emulated his idol with a history-making performance in Qatar to settle the GOAT debate.
articles.content:
Lionel Messi had won just about everything there was to win at club level and now following Argentina’s penalty shootout win against France, he has finally won the World Cup.
